Reviews.Title: “My last visit .....literally.”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Traveller_8
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to this hotel and my last. My last review suggested that attention to detail was missing, it should come as no surprise to find things had not changed. I asked on arrival for an upgrade and was told no and I would have a view of the wall of the next building (standard room corporate booking $260 a night). I met an other person during my stay who was given a suite with a view for $230 a night, she had made her own booking. Breakfast - 1st day none - I left my menu out the night before hanging on my door at 9pm but no-one collected it. When I complained I was assured it would not happen again. They fixed that problem for me by not leaving a room service breakfast menu in my room for the rest of my five day stay. It rained a lot last week which encouraged me to finally try the meals. The meals are fine, despite my order going astray due to their new booking system which did not relay the order to the kitchen. Staff were apologetic and offered a free glass of wine (not forthcoming so had to ask for it). My meal arrived but it was the wrong meal and I had to ask for the salad. I could not bother complaining further and ate what I was given. Will I go back......no.... despite its great location it continues to disappoint. I think that it is strong demand due to its great location and they just cannot be bothered with improving service, whatever the reason .....Accor here I come....goodbye Vibe Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Canucks-down-under
Reviews.Content: Located across from Milson's Point train station and easy walking distance to North Sydney. The first room I was offered faced the road, had a TV that didn't work and looked like it hadn't been cleaned. I asked for a room change and after some debate and a claim they couldn't because they were full another room was found and it was quite acceptable - clean, limited obvious signs of wear and better equipped than the first room. Good place if your looking for cheap, convenience in North Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A great location near Kirrabilli village with easy access to the city.”
Reviews.Author: Flashduck
Reviews.Content: A vibrant village type community on the side of the harbour opposite the Opera House, Milson's Point and Kirribilli provides an excellent base for exploring the Harbour City and its attractions. With direct train services to the city and airport (with a change of train), and a ferry service crossing to Circular Quay, access to the City and CBD is easy, if you tire of the walk across the harbour bridge. Service is professional and friendly, facilitating check in and check out quickly, and attending to minor issues of requiring the room made up earlier, and reformatting the keycard very rapidly. If you are travelling with a vehicle, the location is very difficult for parking, with highly vigilant parking police. On-site parking is available for $25 a day for overnight guests, and is really the only option. The hotel is still stuck in the Australian broadband access mindset of a decade ago. There is allegedly 15 minutes free WiFi available if you buy a drink in the bar on level 1, and in room rates are around $25 a day! Despite these shortcomings, the hotel has remained my favoured option on trips to Sydney from Canberra for sporting and other events. The rooms are spacious for a Big City hotel at this price, the standard of fittings is good and are crisp and contemporary without schmultz. Check their website for good prices online, especially special deals. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to the CBD hotels at a better price”
Reviews.Author: writetomarlon
Reviews.Content: As a Sydney local and international traveller I decided it would be fun to spend 3 months testing out the Quality of Sydney hotels to help recommend the best we've got. Turns out the Vibe North Sydney is a great offering. Most visitors to Sydney think they need to be right in the heart of the city, but Milsons Point is only one train stop north of the city, a 5 minute ferry from Circular Quay and offers some excellent dining options in a peaceful locale. The room service is excellent, the rooms are very comfortable and the hotel is great value. As a local I always recommend visitors to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great if only....”
Reviews.Author: kendahl25
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything necessary for 5/5 except that management is about 2/5. The location is world class, 100m or so to the harbourside, even closer to the rail station, with just one stop, across the bridge to the CBD ... or walk down to the ferry wharf for a great trip to Circular Quay. I just think they're really not capable of user-friendly thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Short Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_from_Canberra
Reviews.Content: The room was simple, clean and well appointed. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Checkout was smooth and efficient. The bedding was very firm but this may be a large plus for other travellers. There were very few local restaurants and nightlife open past 21:00 on a Sunday evening. There were issues with the underground parking barriers and as a result the gates were left open to the street for most of the evening and from quite early the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, convenient, not bad...”
Reviews.Author: jaffle
Reviews.Content: A fraction tired, but all the essentials are there. Rooms a little small, coffee stall out the front is fair to middling, but VERY convenient to North Sydney/Milsons Point, and parking is often included in the room rate. I have never had a room with a view, but for business travel it is totally fine. Staff have been helpful and checkout is smooth and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mainlad2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opposite Milsons Point train station so very handy for transport links. It is also 5 mins walk from the Sydney Harbour Bridge which take about 20 minutes to walk over to get to Central Business District. I paid for an aqua room which came with a view over Kirribirri Bay - a little disappointed as there is a train line and a 8 lane motorway in the foreground. Also my colleague was on the other side of the hotel and had a view over Lavender Bay which was stunning! Swimming pool was very underwhelming. It is about 8 metres long by 2 metres and is freezing cold as in the shade for most of the day. If you want to do some swimming go the Olympic swimming pool down the road that the hotel, apparently, can give you a free pass to. Most of the decent hotels in the CBD are over $250 per night - this is slighter cheaper as on the other side of the harbour bridge but is good value for money. All in all a comfortable stay but just ask for a Lavender Bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at The Vibe on a 2 week business trip with a couple of days sight seeing thrown in. In general couldn't fault the hotel or the staff. We arrived at silly o'clock in the morning off the back of a 24hr flight from London and were found a room within 15 minutes despite the 2pm check in time. The room was quiet and kept clean & spotless by the "invisible" cleaning staff, something which we appreciate a lot is not being hassled at hotels by staff on deadline to clean rooms. The hotel is located 2 minutes walk from Milsons Point station with easy access to just about anywhere in Sydney, you also have access to Sydney Harbour bridge and the walk across to Circular Quay and The Rocks. At the bottom of the road you can pop on one of the many harbour ferries as well. One negative comment: WiFi: I don't mind paying for WiFi at hotels as I find you tend to get a better service than the so called "Free" service from other hotels. However if I pay for WiFi I expect it to cover ALL my devices and not just a maximum of 2. When my wife and I travel on business we take 2 laptops, 2 or 3 WiFi enabled phones and more than likely a Kindle or two. The Vibes WiFi service only allowed 2 devices to be connected at any time and there was no method to "unsubscribe" a device and connect another, forcing us to pay the daily or hourly rate (much more expensive than the weekly rate) and choose which devices to connect for that period. Using the "free" 30 minutes in the Curve restaurant was not an option for us though it may be for other users. I would suggest The Vibes management revisit this 2 device policy or provide a method to unsubscribe devices as paying for WiFi on a daily or hourly basis to get around this or even purchasing multiple WiFi packages does increase the cost to a point where I would considering looking else where to stay. Being picky now: The room safe is not large enough to accommodate 2x 15 inch laptops and there were no anchor points in the room use a Kensington lock to secure the laptop to which is a must these days for business travellers. An anchor bolt fitted to the wall by the room desk is a $20 upgrade at most. All in all though a very good hotel in a great location in one of the best cities in the world

Reviews.Title: “having a change”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay in the Sydney CBD but this year we saw a good deal for the Vibe across the bridge and went for the change as we came across a good deal. The staff were welcoming and very helpful and efficient and the room was excellent and we were so impressed that we booked a return for a couple of days before we left Sydney, We were on one of the top floors with good views of the harbour. The Pool was quite small, but at least they had one, and they also provided free access to the North Sydney Olympic pool just down the road for serious swimmers. The hotel is near a nice little village style of shops and restuarants. I also has a good bus service, is next to Milson's point railway station and the harbour ferries are down the road after the pool. When we went away for a couple of days they stored our luggage for us until our return which was very helpful -- different staff but they still met the above criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HelenJ44
Reviews.Content: We booked this accommodation through a mystery deal for a good price and after reading some reviews on trip adviser, I was a bit tenative about our stay on Saturday night, however I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location opposite the train station and only 2 trains stops from Town Hall. Also only a short walk to the Harbour Bridge. The area is nice and quiet and has a relaxed feel to it and was easy to find. We were on the 10th floor (I think we may have been upgraded). The room was very comfortable, modern and clean and more spacious than I had expected, also very quiet - no noise from adjoining rooms. The staff were also very pleasant - no waiting to be served. We arrived at approximately 11 am and our room was ready. Had no problems at all. Importantly the parking was $25 per night - much less than many in the CBD and without the strict 24 hour limit that many Sydney hotels impose. Would definitely stay again especially for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: JKArnold
Reviews.Content: We did not come to Sydney for a luxury break but had to pay a high price for a very basic room which looked out on to other buildings. With no breakfast or free wifi included and casual service we felt that it was poor value for money. The one thing that was positive was its proximity to the train station so access to central Sydney was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Less hotel, more like a backpackers”
Reviews.Author: cechin
Reviews.Content: Sydney is incredibly expensive and this hotel is very reasonable, all things considered.Â  ProsÂ  - Location: across the street from Milsons Point station, which will take you to CBD in less than five minutes or the airport in half an hour.Â  - It's very quiet. While the hotel was full, I never heard my neighbors or traffic outside. You can hear the trains rumbling by sometimes, but they never woke me.Â  - There are several good restaurants nearby, including the Lounge Bar, which serves up a relatively cheap and quick breakfast. Cash only.Â  - Go the the Kirribilli side to access the pedestrian walk across Sydney Harbour bridge and a lovely park with amazing views of the Harbour and Opera House.Â  - Walk toward the Harbour and you'll find the Olympic pools.Â  - Good sized in-room fridge, so you can buy your own beverages. There are nearby mini marts, but you're better off visiting a Woolworths.Â  Cons - Not really a con, but be aware that this is a rather basic hotel. Amenities are barebones and daily room clean up seemed cursory. I noticed sheets weren't changed after four days, room wasn't vacuumed, bathroom floor wasn't swept, etc. I had to ask the front desk for more shampoo and soap.Â  - Wifi is exorbitant. $24.95 for a day. There's also no complimentary wifi in public areas. Speaking of... - There's really no public area. There's the front desk and a large sofa. That's it.Â  The cons didn't outweigh the pros. I didn't come to Sydney to luxuriate in my hotel and surf the web. A little more attention to daily cleaning would be nice, yes, but I would certainly stay here again if the price were right.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to Luna Park, Sydney Harbour etc.”
Reviews.Author: mbasko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight to visit Luna Park. Excellent location just across from the Milsons Point train station, harbour bridge & a short walk down to Luna Park + Sydney Harbour. Room was very clean, spacious & comfortable. The staff were great even changing our room to allow an earlier check-in time which was greatly appreciated. Had dinner at the Curve restaurant which was very nice & reasonably priced. Although the breakfast was ok I cannot recommend it for the price. Was $28 each for the buffet which was fairly basic. Could have gotten better value from nearby cafes etc. Overall very nice stay & would stay again if revisiting this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, not so good service”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyLA
Reviews.Content: The location in Milson's Point is awesome. It's right across from the train station (yes, you CAN hear the train in the morning.) It's nice because it's in North Sydney, away from the uber-high traffic area of the CBD. But a nice stroll across the bridge, or a quick train ride, takes you right into the main city. Also, there's some very interesting restaurants 100 meters away in Kirribilli (try Kirribilli Hotel for drinks, Garfish for great seafood or Stir Crazy for (relatively) affordable Thai Food. Rooms are good sized w/ couch or two chairs plus very comfy bed. Clean and efficient would be a good description. Get a front-facing room or else you're staring into the apartment complex 5 meters away (and yes, they can stare right back into your room). Bar is nice, restaurant food is quite good and there's an outside terrace overlooking the harbour. Plus: Breakfast is A$ 20.00, but you can often get it comp'd into the rate, or coffee guy right outside the front door, or small breakfast nook one door away. Fridge in room. Olympic pool and fitness center are a short walk away -- ask the front desk for comp passes (you can get one per person per day.) Oh, and it is really Olympic as in it's where they had the swimming during the Sydney Olympics!. Always cabs out front. Negatives: Train noise might be bothersome for some. They charge for internet service (really Vide?) They charge 1.50% extra for paying by credit card (really, really Vibe?) Service is... well...examples. 1) Room wasn't ready at check-in, but they offered to upgrade me to one that WAS ready -- for $75.00 per night. 2) Pipe broke in ceiling above room and flooded the bathroom at 3.30am. Had to pack up everything and move to another room. Not their fault, but didn't comp anything on the room rate at first. After arguing with manager, they finally agreed to knock $100.00 off of a $279.00 per night rate (and mind you, I was there 8 nights.) Definitely should have comp'd the flooded room. Tips: There's little brochures in a rack by the elevator. The one for the Vibe North Sydney contains a 2-for-1 coupon on dinner. Take it and use it! Food is really expensive in Sydney. Sneak a sandwich out of the breakfast buffet for lunch. The staff doesn't mind (in fact one of them suggested I make a sandwich for 'take away.')

Reviews.Title: “Wont go back”
Reviews.Author: MicTra_11
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 5 nights 26-31/1/12 through a deal on Travel Zoo. The hotel was very handy right across the road from Milsons Point Station. That is the only good point. Now the Bad ones - Upon arrival at reception were told we needed to pay an extra $50 deposit per night per room even though our accommodation was already paid for. Then we were advised that our rooms were on different levels (11 & 7) which we were not happy about so the said they would move one of us the next day so we were both on the 7th floor. We had to carry out own bags up to our room, no such thing as a porter. The bathroom in 713 has mould in the shower, the tv remote has tape on the back the tv is so small we couldnt read the names of the tennis players they were cut off. The curtains dont close properly because of the broken tracks. The laundry was right accross the hall which made noise all day and night. The next day when our friends were moved down to the 7th floor next to us they advised reception their aircondioner was not working, then we went out for the day. When we returned at 8pm that night we found the airconditioner was still not working, so theye rang reception again and they new nothing of it so they sent up a nice repair man who said if he couldnt fix they would be moved to another room again. So at 9.30 at night they had to move rooms again back up to the 11th floor. Also they were advised they had to move their own things as there was no one to help. Overall very poor service. The breakfast was very basic but the view from the restaurant was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great View (from some rooms)....but very dissapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Leggy333
Reviews.Content: - Overcharged. - Room not made up until 3.30pm (6hrs after 'please make up my room' sign hung out) - Executive Suite had minature bathroom (leaking shower - mouldy tiles) - Elevator problems - Manager dissappeared to back room while I was making complaint to staff member standing next to him rather than address my issues. Very friendly maintenance man. ...... not enough to convince me to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel just on the other side of Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: DiederickPhoto
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in Milson's Point. First train stop after Harbour Bridge. It takes you about 5 minutes to get there. very pleasant hotel. friendly staff. Clean and spacious rooms. Good value if you book in advance. Great discounts available on internet.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: bnicole00
Reviews.Content: Blood spots on my rock hard pillow, someone else's hair in the bed, dirty bathroom were a few reasons we won't be back. The only redeeming quality about this sub-par hotel was one of the employees, Yin who was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Grest location but urgently needs upgrade”
Reviews.Author: asinor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its location only as we had stayed there before and knew not to expect anything great. However, it was very disappointing as the room smelt musty and the bathroom although obviously cleaned, needs re-grouting to eliminate the mould. The room is quite claustrophobic and needs a good airing. The hallways are uninviting and certyainly would not give good impressions for first time stayers. The carpet outside the lift on the laundry level doesn't just smell; it stinks. it certainly needs urgent attention. The staff were very friendly and provided the probably only really positive experience there. Cannot recommend until a complete refurb is undertaken.

Reviews.Title: “The management needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: eva_86916
Reviews.Content: The location is just good. The Milsons point train station is just at your doorstep. The breakfast was nice as well.But the management was not good as its location. The reception staff even didn't know our booking details very well. The breakfast was actually included in my room rate, but the staff told me that we hadn't paid for the breakfast. Fortunetly, I took my original booking confirmation with me. The phone in the room was terrible. When I called reception, the phone transferred me to the restaurant!!! The light in the bath room was flashing all the time. I am really sorry to say that the service was definitely not worthy of the value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sdw72
Reviews.Content: After staying in the city near Darling Harbour, staying at the Vibe North Sydney was nice, particularly because it was so close to the train station. As a photographer, the location was fantastic, too, a 5-min walk from the Harbour Bridge and views of the skyline and Opera House. All of the standard amenities of a hotel were as expected, except the wifi was way expensive...$25 per day. The included use pass to the Olympic swimming pool and gym (5-minute walk down Alfred Street) was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Our Review”
Reviews.Author: susanehardy
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean and friendly service and well located to trains and ferries. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what advertised”
Reviews.Author: perkandt
Reviews.Content: There is an element of dishonesty in this hotel which is pervasive and disappointing. This hotel advertises itself as being in Kirribilli where the Prime Minister has her Sydney Residence. In fact the hotel is in Milsons Point which is where Luna Park is. On-site car parking is advertised at $25 per night. Of the three nights we stayed only one night was on-site, the other two nights were 500 metres down a steep hill at the Luna Park car park. At the same price. The advertised swimming pool, which is about 6 metres long, has a scum mark around it. The water pressure in the room flucuates, first your shower is hot, then it is cold. The room we stayed in was tired. They asked for a credit card imprint when we checked in. Of course. No problem. What we didn't expect was for $150 to be charged to our credit card in case we bought anything. Which we didn't, and are still awaiting a refund. This is a hotel that takes greed and misrepresentation to a new level. It is a pity. It could be good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good and very reasonable for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TravelEeOrr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the neighborhood is hard to beat. We elected stay in an executive suite which we were able to get for the price of a normal room with a little haggling and an advance purchase of our stay. The extra 1% for using a credit card was a little bogus, who carries that much cash, but we were still pleased with our stay. Some of the rooms from they higher floors have great views. Check out Cafe Tony ... it's about a block down on the left. We ate breakfast there every day.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koroua
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has a great location but otherwise is pretty basic. Rooms are clean (although it did vary on level from day to day), they are undertaking maintenance to ensure that the appearance in the corridors is good and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay”
Reviews.Author: Feddans
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business. Hotel check in is good. Services not used. Rooms are tired and overpriced compared to similar type around the world. Only stay here as no other viable options near by. Good for a bed and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned.”
Reviews.Author: Goochieboy
Reviews.Content: I recently on a business trip and stayed at the Vibe. Being a regular visitor to Sydney for work I tend to stay at Potts Point and catch the train into the CBD each day. I found the Vibe at Milson Point to be well positioned being across the road from the train station and 1 stop into Wynard. There pleny to see on the morning walk and there's a couple of resutarant near by for dinner. The room was clean and comfortable. WIll definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cicada55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for business and decision was made for me. I can't believe that Australian hotels can get away with the exorbitant wifi charges. My room had a great view and the bedroom was quite large but the bathroom was a bit poky - would be too small for couples. A better chair when working at the desk would be good. Breakfast was OK - would definitely consider it again if the price is right because it's so easy to get into the city with the train station across the road. Staff were OK

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: i stayed in vibe last week for 3 nights and had a great experience. staff were friendly (specially lady receptionist Emelia and indian manager Aaron). The only complaint i have WIFI was very expensive($25.00 per day- quiet expensive compare to other hotels). when i checked in my room A/C was not working. I contacted reception and the lady said they will send someone to have a look at it. Within 5 minute of my phone call the indian manager came and had a look and instantly was able to solve the problem. I was impressed at the quality of service that this hotel gave and would recommend this hotel to anyone corporate or leisure to come and stay there. I am very picky at the type of hotel that I stay with but this one would be my top rated so far. With an amazing view of the harbour and the city I was definitely relaxed even though this was a business trip for me. I would also like to mention the bar on the ground floor had a great "vibe" to it. The food was quiet good. I would definitely stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mbroomhead
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times before and found it very convenient with the Milsons Point train station just over the road and easy walk to Walker Street. The room I had this time had great views and was in pretty good order. Internet connectivity was fast and reliable with iron and board in the room. Staff were friendly and helpful. The bar on the ground floor was pleasant enough to sit in for a bar meal and a drink. Overall, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of North Shore”
Reviews.Author: fernvan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night when we had a cruise party at Levender Bay. The hotel is on the main streen just near Sydney's famous harbour bridge. In terms of price we found with ver affordable and convienient especialy if you have to be around the city of North Sydney till very late. The hotel also has an airport shuttle service in case you need to get to the airport the next morning. The hotel while not in a very high proce bracket is a very clean and comfortable place to stay. If I am in Sydney during the New year celebrations, this is probbly where I would want to stay since teh hotel is almost opposit the harbour, it would be the perfect place to se the fireworks from. My terip was not suring the new year fireworks though but still it was a lovely hotel to stay in, clean rooms, with a well staffed concierge desk even at night when we came in late. We didnt eat anything at the hotel so i cannot vouch for teh food but there are plently of places close by where you can grab bite to eat.

Reviews.Title: “View & location fantastic, be prepared for lies and lack of care from all memebers of staff.”
Reviews.Author: a v
Reviews.Content: I stay at Vibe North Sydney 3 nights every month for the last year because the pros outway the cons. Everything usually is good until when things turn bad, you will find staff don't care, bookings and promises don't matter and junior staff make whoppers of stories with the duty managers just rightly not caring. You are a number and if your number works you will have a good time. When your number is bad it all goes pear shaped here are a couple of things that turned bad, like dogs barking in a room next to yours, asked to park at luna park because of full parking at the hotel with the promise to refund and reimburse and of course of the slog to get said easy refund, cold breakfast, bookings not honored, no suggestions to help you out of bind and all the lies you can eat when you ask "why me tonight?" Vibe Hotel - Milsons Point when you are good you are good. When you are bad you just are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Has a backpackers feel to it.”
Reviews.Author: TheChubbs9123
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Vibe North Sydney. Somehow when you walk in, it really reminded me of a backpackers hostel. So why was I paying so much?! Location: Everyone of the reviewers have mentioned that the location is very good. Unless you are planning to take a train everywhere you go, the location really isn't that great. A cab ride into the city (say QVB for shopping) will set up back by AUD 12 on a Sunday where traffic on the bridge is quite light. The train is about a 3-5 mins walk away though. Room: A really really basic room and bathroom, do not expect any amenties. The wifi in the hotel is very expensive. I think for the 3 day package I paid approx AUD 60. At least the room itself was clean. Note that complimentary bottles of water is not provided. But there is a convenience store about 2-3 mins walk. Food: The complimentary breakfast is really nothing exciting. The usual spread, looked a little like it had been sitting there for awhile and it was 730 in the morning. Didn't bother with breakfast after the first morning. The one thing they did which I appreciated was that they set up a little coffee stand outside the hotel in the morning for you to grab your coffee on the way to work. Service: Typical friendly Aussie service. The one thing that was really shocking, I didn't realise that check-out is at 11am. Somehow the hotels have changed it to 11 from noon? Anyway, when I got back to the hotel, I went up to my room only to realise that my keycard was not working. Headed back down to the reception to have it reset. Lady never mentioned that it is coz I passed my check out time. While I was in my room packing, there was a knock on my door, reception came up to ask when am I planning on leaving?!?! I realise that it is my fault for just assuming and not checking the checkout time but they could have informed me while they reset my card. Being a single traveler I find knocks on my hotel door rather scary.

Reviews.Title: “Very close and convenient to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: Milsons Point railway station just across the road, so very handy and convenient. Room rates cheaper than city hotels and you are only one train station away from the city. Was given a room on Level 6 which had NOT been serviced, and had to argue with reception staff when I went downstairs to change it. They insisted it had been serviced, but bed was un-made, towels on bathroom floor and trash in the bin. Was then given a room on the 12th "Executive" floor which appeared larger, and had the added bonus of a microwave and small sink, plates, knives and forks. View of side of building next door. Water in shower super hot. Bed a bit on the hard side. Overall excellent value for money though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Bryjohn
Reviews.Content: The first feeling when getting to the hotel does fit to the name of this establishment "VIBE" - over all, i had great experience in staying here, unfortunately, was only felt almost on the last few days there. My arrival wasn't that great as i was welcomed by a guy who can't even say 'welcome' with a smile. Fortunately, there are still great staff, "Amelia" was a star there, and not forget the good folks at the breakfast buffet. The location is very business and leisure friendly. Just across the Milson's point station that can bring you to the city or down to the Epping area. Food could be improved but nonetheless not too bad. Perhaps i can recommend variety of breakfast choices. They have fast internet connection, but quite expensive. Hope there's a way to have this included in the future. Overall - I will surely come back to the Vibe, for business, and hopefully with my family too. Cheers to the Vibe! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jojo8785
Reviews.Content: Nice and modern interior with funky decor and beautiful linen. Smallish bathroom but very neat and clean. Friendly and efficient staff. Quiet location with ample parking and not too far a walk from most attractions or train network. Great for businees or overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Austravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable, but the bathroom is small and needs a makeover. Unfortunately most of the rooms look at the apartment next door, although some rooms have harbour views. The conference I attended included breakfast and lunch and both had good variety in the buffet. Staff at the hotel were friendly and it was easy to get to everything with a station across the road or a ferry at the end of the street. It was also nice to be able to walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge before work for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Incorrectly charged for minibar use. Took over 2 weeks to sort it out.”
Reviews.Author: Wayne M
Reviews.Content: Good location, staff seem OK. After we had checked out, they left a message saying that we had used the mini-bar and charged our credit card. I rang and informed them that we hadn't. OK..we'll refund. Took 2 more phone calls over next 2 weeks to finally get it done. NOT HAPPY, JAN. I was going to stay with kids and do Luna Park.... Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel15
Reviews.Content: one night booked for a conference and was nothing special. Parking the car had the usual hotel difficulties of narrow spaces and small turning points. Buffet breakfast was adequate but very over priced. Room was basic and difficulty regulating shower temperature. And final point was the 20 minute wait in line to check out. Thinking there are probably better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still the place to Stay in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Brisbane
Reviews.Content: As a regular I must again confirm that the management and staff continue to strive to look at what can be done better, even when it's great. The changes to the bar area have been well thought out and the flexabity in the kitchen ensures even fussy buggers like me are catered for. Well done folks and keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way over priced for what it is, you can stay in the heart of downtown in the Marriott or Hilton or Sheraton for much better rates. If you find yourself stuck here don't buy the breakfast option the food isn't edible. The hotel is old and not well kept up, it is in dire need of a refurb. There is an unpleasant odor throughout the entire property as well. Front desk staff is moderatly helpful/polite. Don't waste your money, stay in a nice, clean hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: Excellent room with a fantastic view overlooking the harbour. Well presented and very clean. Flat screen TV's in both rooms and all normal facilities. Whoever is responsible for the staff attitude here is doing a great job- from reception to the cleaners through to the restaurant staff - all had a great attitude and were friendly and attentive. Most unnusual and far above the norm. 2 small things- the towels are way too small and only two per room? And whilst the seafood banquet cooked food was good- the fresh portion wasn't. If its too hard to do fresh then don't bother. Stick with the cooked only and you'll have a winner But the pluses far out weight the minuses - well done

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is average”
Reviews.Author: TheSnakebite
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed here on a business trip. Location is excellent for some good restaurants in this area and the hotel is located opposite the train station (allowing easy access to the CBD) and also the ferry terminal which is a 5 minute walk down to the harbour. The hotel has a full bar and restaurant (Curve restaurant). The restaurant was average. Shutting the bar at 10pm on a Saturday night was a real-downside for our group, and also heaps of others who wandered in. Nothing worse than wanting a drink and the bar is closed. Rooms are pretty average-but the en-suite needs updating. Showers are over-the-bath which I don't like. Breakfast was typical buffet, but nothing special. I doubt it was worth the pre-booking cheaper rate, but was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Garry1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, who are Sydneysiders, stayed here overnight recently and were both pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and quality of the room. We stayed on the 6th floor in a queen size room which was in keeping with a 3-4 star hotel. The bed was comfortable and gave us a good nights sleep. The bathroom had all the standard appointments and although very clean and reasonably new, was quite cramped. Our stay included breakfast and there was a wide range of cooked and cold foods available that were tasty and plentiful. The concierge staff were very helpful although having to use the overflow carpark about 10 minutes walk up a steep hill was not optimal. For those who prefer to come by public transport the hotel is opposite the Milsons Point Railway Station with direct and short access to the city. Alternatively a ferry ride across our beautiful harbour is another option. Overall we were happy with our short stay and would go there again if the opportunity presented.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: holidays70
Reviews.Content: The vibe hotel is in a wonderful location, just across the road from Milsons Point station. The staff were polite and helpful. We booked the seafood package. It included a deluxe queen room with a beautiful view of the harbour, seafood platter and a bottle of wine for dinner, breakfast and 12pm check-out. After checking in to the hotel we enjoyed exploring the local Saturday markets before walking across the Harbour Bridge to the Rocks area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooking pool and bay fantastic. Short walk to the bridge,station ferry lunar park and over the road brilliant food . What e”
Reviews.Author: santorini66
Reviews.Content: Could not be better. My Claire and I plus my sister and her husband frank. And Chris and rick were there to see everything we could before flying to Perth. The hotel was stunning it is not in the center but a 15 min walk over the bridge ,5 min walk down to luna. PAto to. Catch the ferry, also 2 min walk for the train. I would advise. to go to doyles on the beach for A MEAL JUST ASK AND GET THERE. I can only. SAy stunning

Reviews.Title: “Missing the extras”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Traveller_8
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Vibe Hotel and still find it missing something. I had a room on the 14th floor with a view of a wall of the next building but I could see the water and the roads leading to the harbour bridge, so no problem there. The room looked like it had had half a renovation rather than a full one, with an old cupboard still in place. Pillows .... I have been spoilt for choice at hotels such as Novotel, Crown Plaza and Stamford where a range of pillow types are offered. I dare not think how many times mine had been used before me. Tea and coffee offered in the room, always horrible and this was no exception so take my own supply. I think the problem is lack of attention to detail, for example I asked for a paper with my breakfast tray and did not get it. There was no breakfast for the second morning, so I left the hotel and had breakfast elsewhere and had the luxury of three papers! It is not a bad hotel at all, it could quickly be improved with attention to detail. Location is fantastic, right outside Milson Point Railway Station which is why I stay, but next time I may reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Really a very bad experience...will never go back...”
Reviews.Author: Richa25
Reviews.Content: I was at this property for almost a week in April 2011. Had the worst hotel stay ever. The house keeping did such a pathetic job in cleaning up the room. Everyday you come back after a long day at work - and you will find the room cleaned up - but not properly...for example for two consecutive days the cup I used to have a early morning cup of tea was unwashed and was lying in the sink... The least the staff could do is replace the cup...and I called up and complained about this at the reception, but that too went into deaf years... This is definately something unaccepatble...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, handy to the Sydney harbour and the city”
Reviews.Author: est_888_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed last Saturday night, with another couple. We were attending an event at Luna Park. Great spot to stroll down the hill and be right under the Sydney Harbour Bridge, see Luna Park, and gaze across at the Opera House and Circular Quay. Quiet Iconic really. We were in rooms 204 and 205 respectivly and had a view of the wall on the building next door about 4 meters away; This was fine as we had got a wotif secret deal and we were going out that night. Very dark and depressing room however and so if you want to stay a few days and have a bit of an outlook, then I suggest you discuss your preferences with the hotel. Milsons Point train station about 100 meters away. From here the train goes straight over the harbout bridge with the first stop being Wynyard, then Town Hall. You are in the middle of the city at either of these stops. Quiet neighbourhood, but enough resturants nearby for you to eat out for several nights if you wish, Some nice coffee shops nearby. Staff pleasant, no complaints from me, but our demands were pretty low. Room in the chocolate brown look. Small lounge. Bathroom adequate: shower over bath. Mini bar pricey, but a BWS is on the other side of the station, and a few little convenience stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: Harrietah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just after a cruise in April. The staff were friendly and efficient and let us book in early. We had a room on the top floor with a beautiful view of the harbour, in fact we could watch our ship sailing away! The room was large, furnished to a high standard, well maintained and very quiet. After having looked at many hotels in the CBD, we found this to be a great alternative. You would be paying a much more for this standard of accomodation in the CBD, yet this hotel which is situated in Milson's Point is only a short distance away at the end of the bridge. It is near a train station and you can even walk to the CBD over the bridge. There are also many shops and restaurants within an easy waling distance. All in all this was a great find and we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, lousy restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Wobblyman
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff, avoid breakfast, don't leave anything in your room when checking out it is NEVER found. Frequent flyer points never credited

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonPam82
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying 3 nights at the Vibe hotel over Easter. The Vibe is in a great location with plenty of restaurants and cafe's with public transport - trains and ferries on your doorstep. Even though the weather wasn't great on a couple of the days, we still got out and about - picnicking down by the harbour, Kirribilli markets, long walks over the bridge and through The Rocks and around the opera house, ferry to Balmain for lunch, a day in Luna park, breakfast and dinners in the local restaurants. Our room was great, we paid a little extra for the deluxe room, although the wardrobes and sink area did look a little tired, it was very clean. Our room was great, we paid a little extra for the deluxe room, although the wardrobes and sink area did look a little tired, it was very clean. We have stayed in several hotels in this area for approximately the same price but I would recommend The Vibe for this location over other local hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RoryJ76
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, throughout Australia. Of all the hotels I stay in I really appreciate the Vibe for its warmth and friendly service. Given its great location and harbour views it offers good value for money. There are a number of good restaurants very close by. I always have breakfast at the hotel. I note that other reviewers have complained about noise. I have stayed there many times and have never had any such problems.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Vibe Hotels”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel because we had to attend a wedding reception at Aqua Dining, which was near by. We got a special rate of $140 because the bride had special price arrangements with the hotel. The hotel in the end did over charge us, this we are still trying to get resolved. The hotel is conveniently located near Milson's Point train station. You can pay $25 extra for a view and $22 for parking. There is ample parking spots, and if the hotel car park is full you can park at a car park near Luna Park. The hotel is quite nice. A lot more better than their other Vibe hotels. The rooms are spacious and modern. The bathrooms are nice and clean too.! We had been allocated a room on the 8th floor. Unfortunately we had very noisy neighbours who made very loud noises past midnight. The staff at reception are very polite and helpful. Liked the additional free copy of Marie Claire magazine available at reception. For travellers, the hotel is minutes from the Harbour Bridge and Luna Park. Nice safe area.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel maybe ok for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: milmalcolm
Reviews.Content: Originally booked into room 710 but the room had a musty damp smell. On complaining to the front desk tey offered us a slightly smaller room on the 5th floor. The room had a nice view of lavender bay. We could hear noise from our neighbouring rooms and were disturbed by houskeeping at 9am one morning. Breakfast was very average so would recommend using one of the several nearby cafes for your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay where the staff always make the effort to ensure their clients are looked after.”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Brisbane
Reviews.Content: As a regular interstate traveller I stay at a variety of properties and have the choice to choose. After switching between services apartments and hotels, I have in the last two years made Vibe North Sydney my number one choice in Sydney. It's location is second to none, local restaurants, trains across the road, short walk to city or North Sysney and the morning walk around the harbour foreshore via Lavendar Bay and Luna Park is one of Australia's best. The Vibe has it's rare days, and I say rare days where little things are not right, but in all my stays (in excess of 150 nights) I've only ever asked for a change and it was nothing to do with the service or the hotel itself. The prompt and sincere response I got from their manager Mia was brilliant. The vibe management are regularly seeking out feedback and improvements which is a great way to keep on the front foot for customer service. I can honestly say, they don't just take it in and smile, they act and follow-up. The staff on reception, resturant and bar always make the effort to remember their customers and personalize the service, excellent work guys and it's something that I've not only noticed, appreciate. When new staff join the Vibe team, clearly the management have put in place a proactive training strategy to ensure that personalize customer service is maintained, proven as recent as this week with a new member Abby, referencing me by name, acknowledging my return visit and providing with a complimentary welcome gift. The new GM, Matt has made himself accessible to his customers and clearly has instilled this in his own management team. The management team in Mia, Janine, James and the head chef (sorry im bad on names), but all approachable, all great people. I will confess I miss the duck from the menu and would like to see a currie added to the regular menu given some of the great meals I've sampled which are not always on the menu. The steaks are good and the fact the chefs will accomodate your dietry requirements where they can is appreciated, and the after hours pizza's and chicken ceasar salad are brilliant. The Vibe rooms are good and well appointed, they like all hotels have the bigger and more expensive rooms and as a regular guest I also appreciate the upgrades and the fact that it's always provided when the occupancy is not 100%, great work and a privilege I appreciate as a regular, thanks for that. Its not 5 star resort, but the people in the Vibe are and they provide a 5 star service. Thanks guys for looking after myself and my company colleages. Keep up the great work and no doubt i will see you next week. Brian

Reviews.Title: “An fabulous location right next to the train station..and the hotel staff was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: postcardgrl
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't have been better-train station across the street, access to walking across the Sydney Harbor Bridge, Luna Park down the street, and easy access to markets, chemists (pharmacies), great restaurants,and wine shops. The hotel itself was clean, our housekeepers did a great job, and the food at the breakfast location was wonderful! The staff at the hotel was so helpful-especially Charlotte. Every day I had questions and they were more than happy to guide me with directions or advice. It made my vacation so easy! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended! Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: lellijay
Reviews.Content: For us this was the perfect location. Just over a kilometre over the harbour bridge if you wanted to walk into the city - actually took us about 15 minutes stroll! The Milsons Point railway station was directly across the road from the hotel, and so was the bus stop - excellent if you didn't want to walk! We decided to walk, even tho the weekend was a little drizzly - it was great for a change - and besides, the railway station was closed due to maintenance on the line! The room was adequate, though a little on the small side, and for a double room, I thought 3 pillows was rather a strange amount for 2 of us... easily solved, I rang housekeeping and 3 more were brought promptly up! We ordered room service mid afternoon, only because there was no-one on duty in the downstairs bar, but the menu was the same price and items for room service, and we decided it was worth paying the $4 service charge to get the food in our room so that we could drink our own beverages that we'd brought with us rather than paying hotel prices - this probably more than saved our $4 service charge! We ordered a chicken satay pizza and some shoestring fries with garlic mayo and I have to admit, it was absolutely delicious, and a perfect amount for the 2 of us (we only needed a snack as were out for dinner early the same evening) We had a lovely comfortable sleep, and enjoyed the view from our window when we woke up in the morning and had our coffee. Our breakfast was very nice too. There was a good choice of fruit, breads, cereals etc, and the hot breakfast was a buffet type, and also very tasty by the way (except for the really strange bhaji/hash browns - they had vegetables in them, and the scrambled eggs were a little on the runny side, but at least they tasted like egg, unlike another hotel brand I stayed at) All the staff were very friendly and extremely courteous. We'd only booked a standard room, and asked for an upgrade to a room with a view as we were worried that due to the distance from the hotel next door, we could end up looking out of our window onto a wall. This was no problem at all for the staff, and for an extra $20 it was well worth it - ok, we didn't have a full view of the harbour bridge, but we were right above it, and could see all the traffic which I personally sort of liked anyway! We also could "just" see the opera house if you tried hard enough, but we had the most wonderful view of north sydney and the harbour. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone wanting to be right on the doorstep of the centre of the city, but not wanting to pay the price of a city hotel. This cost us $249 for 2 of us including the room service ($29), breakfast (included in our rate), the upgrade ($20) and the secure car parking for the night under the hotel ($22), the hotel was clean, and like I said it had a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Good location good facilities”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vibe for two nights on business. Great location for the north side of Sydney. There are plenty of restaurants and bars near it. Also some convenient stores nearby. Milsons Point train station directly across from the Hotel also the ramp on and off the Sydney Harbour bridge. Great views from the East facing rooms, but the din of traffic and trains is slightly audible. There is internet available but fairly pricey. Had a Turbocard which was quite good given the location. Parking costs $22.00 per day, which is a bit expensive but what do you do? Staying there again in a few weeks time.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, but staff undertrained.”
Reviews.Author: dancer62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night since our company office is in the same street. Sydney is expensive for hotel rooms, since the AUD is so strong. Internet costs AUD 24.50 for 24 hrs, so did not use that. The hotel location is across the road from Milsons Point Rail station, so easy to get to from the airport. There are also delis, cafes and a convenience store nearby. A very good location for business or tourists. I was fortunate to get a junior suite (Room 811) - one of the front corner ones with a balcony & a spectacular view of the Harbour and even the Opera House (if I sood at the window & looked sideways). The room was divided into living and sleeping areas, and there was a kettle, microwave and plates etc in the living area. Very handy for a simple breakfast. My biggest bugbear however was the staff, who could not answer my question about calling a toll free number from the room. In most hotels, a toll free number should not attract charges, but after going through several staff members (who seemed not to understand what I was talking about) they told me that it would be charged at local call rates. Seeing as I wanted to participate in a 1 hour teleconference, that would have cost me AUD 48!!! If this is really true, this is 100% profit for them, so be warned. On checkout also. it took several attampts to get my hotel bill in the right format - buisness travellers often need the bill to be made out to the company name for tax purposes. This took several attempts, despite my handing them a business card. So - great location, nice room, poor service. Would go back, but downgrade my service expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: naga1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we attended the Ashes cricket test. This hotel was at a reasonable price for January and is superbly located for transport. The train is directly across the road and the ferry just down the road. Our room was spacious and had a great view of the harbour. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We have previously stayed on the north side of the bridge and love the location. We had no problems with the staff or any noise. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the business traveller, perfectly adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallabyGold
Reviews.Content: OK, first off Hotels in Sydney are Super expensive, which is what makes the vibe a good choice as it is just over the Harbour Bridge in North Sydney, but with the train station right over the road and it being a very short taxi ride to the CBD it's in a great location for the business traveller. The hotel itself is nothing special, not sure where the vibe comes in, but the rooms were very good average hotel rooms that you get anywhere. I was staying in the executive suites and they were large, roomy, comfortable but I wouldn't call them funky, the vibe is business. Couple of comments, staff aren't fully briefed by management as to the hotel status, it was 35 degrees when I was there so I went down to reception in my swimmers holding my beach goggles to get something from reception on my way to the pool. I forgot what level the pool was on so asked at reception, then headed up (its second floor by the way) only to find out it is shut and looks like it has been for quite some time. I wasn't happy as it was pretty obvious why i wanted to know where the pool was (I was evening holding swimming goggles), so went back downstairs in a bit of a mood to tell the guy exactly what I thought about his hotel knowledge. Not my proudest moment, but at least I didn't carry on like an idiot. In any case the manageress heard and apologized. Also, bear in mind when you check in to ask for an internet cable as they aren't in the room, and they won't send someone up with a cable, I had to come back down to reception to pick one up, which again is kinda annoying....Overall though very good business hotel and I will most likely stay there next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Jammdee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in Jan 11 in a guest room. The hotel it's self is perfectly fine, the 4 star rating is a stretch however as the service is a big letdown. We had to prove to the staff that we had a free bottle of wine on arrival, the receptionists huffed & puffed whenever you had a request. Such a shame because the location & the facilities are very good. Also the bar closing early doesn't help!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoDavid
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from the train station in North Sydney, the Vibe was amazingly accessible to all of Sydney's attractions, thanks to frequent train service. The hotel is clean and modern, with large rooms, and excellent service. No negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Where was the vibe?”
Reviews.Author: ColossalYouth
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I understand that marketing departments and "brand managers" don't actually have to present the truth...but this is way off the mark. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is comfortable, clean and well situated next to Milsons Point Station. But, needing to stay for 16 days, I checked in here hoping that it would suit my "nerdy needs" as well as my comfort expectations. To my point....this chain markets itself to a young upmarket audience. An audience that would have laptops, I-Phones etc. The 'Vibe" of the place starts (and ends) at reception with bright colours and big photos of trendy young things. But get to the room, and it is a standard business hotel. And that is my point, I expected to find... 1. An IPod dock (after all, I am young, trendy and hip) - NO - just an old clock radio. 2. Free Internet (like the rest of the world) - NO - $25 PER DAY!!!!!!! 3. A TV with a digital signal - NO (the picture was very grainy and everyone was short and fat). 4. A "happening bar" - NO - (it closed at 10pm one night when I was trying to get a drink) Also, having stayed for over 2 weeks at FULL RACK RATE I expected to be treated with some respect when asking to extend...maybe a weekly rate price??? NO. I was told that I would pay daily rates at full rack rate price for my 3rd week (which I declined). It was comfortable, but someone should connect the marketing team with the actual building and try to have at least some synchronicity between the "story" and "the experience".

Reviews.Title: “Mixed service - average at best”
Reviews.Author: MysteryIdiot
Reviews.Content: We caught a 6am (jetstar) flight (so 5am wake-up) and had booked an early check in because we knew we would be exhausted and wanted to catch up on sleep before heading off to a friend's wedding later in the afternoon. We arrived at 9am which I know is way too early, but were wanted to be at the top of the list for early check in. We left to have brunch with a friend and were back at 12.30pm and still no call for early check in. We were being really polite throughout but were told in a snippy tone that early check ins are not guaranteed. We watched in the lobby as probably a dozen couples check in with no trouble...but our early check in is not available. We go for coffees, to check out the local area and such. Finally, after much checking back and asking we were able to check in at 1.50pm - 10 minutes early, but I am aware that early check in is not guaranteed so take it in my tired stride, but a bit miffed that other people have been checking in while we waited without difficulty. Got to room, which was of a decent size, clean and comfortable. Was missing a remote control and TV could not be operated manually. Had to convince reception that there wasn't a remote and that yes, we had checked everywhere (including under and behind bed and sofa, in bathroom, in all draws and cupboards). Eventually after much convincing reception rustled up a spare for us. Next morning housekeeping overlooked our do not disturb and woke us up - a minor inconvenience. Otherwise the stay was fine, we asked nothing more from the service team and were appropriately rewarded. Walls seemd a bit thin, but I was tired enough to sleep through anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: PRBMEL
Reviews.Content: Working in North Sydney this was easy access to Train, and Offices.. but staying in hotels frequently, this hotel looks fine on the outside, but the attention to detail is very poor and prompted me to write my very first trip advisor review - perhaps so Vibe can lift their standards? Good Points: Location was excellent, view over lavender bay and sunset nice. The presentation of the room is fine on the surface and bed was comfortable. Bad Points: 1) Several Hairs in shower/bath - they were not mine. 2) Streaks in shower, pool of water on floor. 3) Room was like a sauna when I arrived, aircon off, took a good hour to come good. 4) Water glasses located in bottom drawer of TV cabinet. Not easy to find - why not in bathroom or fridge like most other hotels? 5) No stationary or pens in desk to fill out breakfast card - a single pen was tucked up beside the bedside clock. 6) Bedside clock was about 6 hours out, with alarm set (which I thankfully caught and disabled) 7) Food was terrible. In restaurant/cafe and in room service. Chicken Pizza was absolutely disgusting. 8) Filled out breakfast card clearly, yet the berry compote with fresh low fat yogurt was just a bowl of warm berry yogurt. Croissants with preserves were tiny and not plain - just chocolate and strange marzipan flavor - how can you put jam on these? I clearly stated muesli, but the guy who delivered it stated that "I hadn't specified" so gave me corn flakes (I let it pass). The breakfast card also stated a minimum spend, service charge and other hidden costs on top - non-standard! 9) Iron was broken - or at least the stream function decided not to to work. 10) Shower fluctuated from hot to cold, then boiling hot for whole shower. Confirmed for other rooms also. 11) TV was turned off (no standby) and remote was behind it. 12 No "turn down" service, arrived in evening and as half of the room was windows, had to walk around closing all the curtains. 13) Staff was nonchalant and totally non-attentive, including reception staff on check-in and check-out. This hotel has a great location with good views and on the outside looks modern and 'hip'. One of the small issues above is forgivable in any hotel, but when u encounter something dodgy at every turn it all adds up. Yes maybe the above list is splitting hairs (not mine ;) but when u pay good money for a room, you expect more. Maybe your experience will be different, but my colleague and I wont be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LouisCypher
Reviews.Content: Fantastic position. Recommend Junior Suite. One negative - and it's huge. The access to the underground car park is ridiculously narrow, Enter at own risk. Note the scraped paint on the rails !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ellipsis000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night. The location was ideal and it was a good start with the reception staff, polite and friendly. I was on the 9th floor and you could smell the kitchen from the 1st floor as I got out the lift. The room key needed fiddling each time to gain access. The room was OK, but the tea and coffee had been counted out - two bags of tea, two of coffee. I ordered a steak via room service - medium rare and steamed vegetables. The steak was mostly red raw and the vegetables were chunky and hard. The airconditioner kept me warm but only had two temperatures, cold or hot. The shower was great in the morning, streaming hot water, until someone nearby flushed and it went cold on me (twice). I heard everything the room next door was watching on TV. Not a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, great dinners, terrible breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: paulhb
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel. Room was very nice, staff were friendly. The restaurant was great for dinner, although perhaps a little overpriced. Breakfast was really expensive ($28 for buffet), and was really oily. Cooked breakfast doesn't have to mean litres of grease sitting in bain marie. I gave them the benefit of the doubt, and thought it may have been a one-off, so had breakfast again the next morning - same problem. Unfortunately, a good breakfast is one of my key criteria, so I probably wouldn't stay here again. If the breakfast is not important to you, I would recommend the hotel - everything else is good.

Reviews.Title: “bad vibes!”
Reviews.Author: zizzle14
Reviews.Content: Im an experienced traveller. On check in I asked for a quiet non smoking room and was told that quiet room could not be guaranteed, but it was non smoking floor. Was given non smoking "suite" room with lovely view, however it had a strong musty, mouldy stale smell that did not clear with airconditioning on for 2 hours. Decor old, carpet old, quilt cover was crumpled and looked like someone had used it before- cleanliness pretty average, there was an old microwave on a tatty wooden bench with small old style sink unit in main room, bathroom tiny. So called Executive Desk was tiny. No hotel information in room so no advice as to internet charges. I asked for a change of room and was told there was no similar room available, or pay $100 AUD extra to be downgraded to a twin room with no view. Housekeeping arrived and offered an "ozone machine" to clear the smell (obviously I wasnt the first person to complain about this and I was told that it was a problem in other rooms as well) but I had to vacate the room for half an hour while it was on as it was "dangerous" to be in the room while it was operating. When I said I wanted to check out I was immediately shown a similar room one floor down with a similar mouldy smell. I was then told that it was the airconditioning in the hotel that caused the smell not the room itself. I checked out and was charged the full rate for the night even though I pointed out that it was unsuitable accomodation that had caused the problem. The manager was dismissive and disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “No vibe at all...”
Reviews.Author: hitchhiker2thegalaxy
Reviews.Content: Coming from a Business trip from Asia, I probably have slight over expectation from a service point of view, but what I have experienced at Vibe is about 2 Star quality: - Food is rather low quality - Internet Service not working - Asked for a paper - did not get any - View is not existent - Friendliness not existent - Environment/ furniture 80 style, management did not invest since then...

Reviews.Title: “lovely location and room!!”
Reviews.Author: charlyy1
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Vibe hotel mid April, 2010. We had a lovely stay here at the Vibe hotel North Sydney. The staff were very friendly and prompt. The room was spotless and spacious with amazing views of the sydney harbour bridge!! The bathroom was nice- Clean and had everything you would expect. The beds were also notible comfortable. There were big wordrobes, extra bedding and a safe to keep valubles. The room included coffe and tea making facilities, a microwave and cutlery/crockery. The decor is all nice and modern and i beleive every room has floor to ceiling windows which are quite spectacular. The Hotel also features a small out door swimming pool which is nice with a pleasent aspect and view of Lavender bay. It is as i said rather small but still nice to cool off in if it is a very hot day. Otherwise there is a lap and leasure pool about 200m down the road. The buffet breakfast is quite amazing with abit of everything!! it is excellent value if included ion a package. However it is $28 otherwise and i would recommend you go top one of the many lovely cafes, reasturants or bakerys in Kirrabilli. If you are travelling with young children Luna Park is only a five minute walk done the road and is a lovely little theme park with alot of the rides and attractions with a 1950's feel. I really recommend a walk across the Harbour Brige in the evening. The Rocks area has alot of nice quaint pubs, bars and restaurants which is just over the bridge and is a pleasant 20 minute walk from the Vibe. So overall i would give the Vibe hotel a 10/10. Everything about our stay was wonderfull and i really couldn't recommend it more!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL WAS NICE”
Reviews.Author: cinemaxGandhinagar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Was Nice Spacious,Trendy,Beautiful,Amiazing,Worth Visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location but terrible food”
Reviews.Author: AlicedeSantiago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed year after year at the Vibe in my business trips to Sydney. The locations it's great since is less than a block from the train station and just a block from many nice small restaurants and shops. The rooms are ok and if you are lucky could get one with a view. Missing for me a coffee machine and a good hairdryer. The only dissapointing point and that has increase year after year itÂ´s the terrible food service. Both room service food and the breakfast buffet are terrible. The good thing it's that I would recommend to walk a block or just walk to the corner and get some nice and money value meal.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable option to consider”
Reviews.Author: MtnBrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe North Sydney (Milson' Point) in January 2010. The hotel has an interesting location which might work for your travel plans. It is located across the street from the train station, and a five minute walk from the ferry. Its proximity to public transportation makes it convenient to get around. It would be a hotel to consider if you want to stay outside the CBD, yet be close to either the CBD or North Sydney. (I believe they even offer a shuttle service to North Sydney.) If you are a tourist with only a few days to see Sydney, then this probably isn't the hotel for you. It is also located close to shops and restaurants. It is also reasonably quiet. The rooms at the Vibe are adequate - maybe 3.5 star rather than 4. The finishings are not fancy or flashy, but are comfortable enough. The least comfortable feature of the room was the airconditioning. It was difficult to control the temperature setting - usually too hot or too cold. There was a mini fridge in the room, which was a nice convenience. The hotel was adequately clean, but certainly not spotless. The hotel does not have a fitness centre on site, but does give you a pass to a nearby gym if you ask for one. They have a pool. In addition, there is one complimentary washing machine and dryer, which is handy if doing a lot of travel. Internet access was pricey. There were two computer stations in the lobby, offering extremely slow internet connections for too high a price. Only have the buffet breakfast if it is included in your room rate, otherwise it is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks James and all the staff at Vibe”
Reviews.Author: michaeljackson1977
Reviews.Content: really nice stay at vibe hotel milsons point. staff were very friendly. On arrival i was upgraded as promised when i booked and what a room it was. Beautiful views across lavender bay. Location of hotel is excellent. I would also like to give a special to James Roberts. He was food and beverage manager. He was very friendly and went that extra mile to make my stay a better one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is diry and has too may problems-- needs a total refurbish!!!”
Reviews.Author: Underworldtravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not honor the upgrade promised me by Expedia when I mad the booking. The $19.50 parking fee is a waste as there is never space at night in their garage. So you have to pay extra to park on the street where meters operate fro 8:00 am to midnight. The hotel does not have phone instruction in the room like other hotels. At checkout they bill you 80 cents for every call you made using a prepaid phone card. Quite a rip off. The elevators, carpets in the hallways and the rooms are old and dirty. The walls in the hallways and the rooms desperately need paint. The shower door is only half way so the floor gets flooded every time. The AC is noisy and so is the plumbing. This hotel could no have been renovated in June 09 and advertised by the hotel. Stay here only if you are desperate or don't care about wasting your money. The garage is very narrow and it's evident by all the crash and graze marks on the dirt walls. . The roll up door to the entry and exit of the garage either get stuck or sometimes drop as you pass under.. areal hazard. Someone needs to check this hotel for health and safety hazards. HAve travelled extensively worldwide but never stayed at a hotel for $169 per night+tax+parking+internet and then found the hotel to be a 1 star hotel, not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great package for grand final weekend”
Reviews.Author: Melbournecaroline
Reviews.Content: Booked at short notice, very little available in CBD due to long weekend, enjoyed this superb location, great room with terrific view which accomodated our family of 4 well, extras included for w/e package incl, nearby pool & Luna Park & breakfast, have also stayed at Vibe Rushcutters find they're a consistent good value chain

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY @ THE VIBE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MotelCRITIC
Reviews.Content: To whom this may concern, my time at the Vibe was complete disaster! I asked for the sofa to be made at 12 o'clock, when i checked-in at 2 o'clock it was not made. I asked for wine and chocolates and they were not there. I asked for a room with a double and a single they failed to tell me that the single was an unmade sofa! The VIBE north sydney is near the busy Carhill Expressway and the noise wasn't that good. The only good thing is that it is near Milson's Point train station. BTW Don't bring any children and expect to eat in the VIBE becuase no child would eat any dish on the menu, and the swimming pool and guest laundry is small and old.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spindle99
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Vibe, the staff were friendly. The room was a very good size, clean and tidy. The view could have been better (the main window facing an apartment block), we had room service one night (the restaurant was shut due to function) and the food was very good and value for money. We got a taxi from the airport costing $50 including toll for the bridge, I would recommend using the train service as it's alot cheaper and always on time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, easy access to downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PaulDHansen
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, easy access to downtown Sydney (one stop on the train), great views of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Melb5
Reviews.Content: Feel compelled to write a review after reading some of the harsh criticism of the hotel. Our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children aged 10 and 7) stayed for four days during September 09 and thought it was great value for money. Obviously not a 5 star hotel, as my 10yo pointed out, but it is certainly 4 star. My husband and I had stayed there a long time ago and remembered it favourably. It is in an excellent location, opposite Milsons Point Railway station (2 stops from Central Quay) and a 5 minute walk from Milsons Point ferry. The Kirribilli shops and cafes are a 2 minute stroll on the other side of the station and we ate there most mornings and evenings and I recommend a stroll around this charming area, checking out the PM's and GG's houses. There is a great park 100m down the road that my children insisted on visiting every day. We booked a senior suite - 2 large rooms, flat screen lcd tv, desk, sofa/bed, king bed and lots of big windows with a water view (could even see the Opera House off to the right) Only criticism of the room would be the tiny bathroom, although given it included a bath, it was more than adequate. Hotel pool was ordinary, but they offer free passes to North Sydney Olympic Pool and Gym which is 5 minutes down the road and the kids spent an afternoon there enjoying the excellent facilities. It was fantastic being so close to the city, one morning we all walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge (which you could almost touch from the hotel), another morning caught the 2 storey train (a novelty for the kids), but mostly travelled everywhere by ferry. We would absolutely recommend this hotel as good value for money and out of the touristy hustle and bustle of the cbd - book on the hotel's website or direct for a great price. If you can afford it - the senior suite is a pretty good size for a Sydney hotel and don't forget to explore nearby Kirribilli.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky!”
Reviews.Author: cityriver
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The deco was very interesting with vibrant colours. I stayed in a Junior Suite and adored my room. Only thing I can fault was no desk in a Junior Suite! I was stuck on the couch with my laptop. My room was very clean and I had lovely views of North Sydney off my large balcony. Staff were very prompt with answering questions and food arrived to my room quickly. No dramas, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel the vibe.”
Reviews.Author: MikekNZ
