Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Late Jan - was a short weekend away, I have been to Sydney many times and usually stay around Circular Quay butmy rationale for picking this hotel was the fact it was on the northshore and I wanted to explore some northshore beaches and the fact it had carparking (checked before we left) as i would have a rental car. Overall thou, an average to disappointing stay, firstly the hotel is getting a little worn, the rooms are average at best and could do with some modernising, if your looking for LCD tv's, nice beds and furniture or a modern bathroom then this is not the place, none of these are unusual in other so called 4 star hotels, dont get me wrong there was nothing bad about the room, it was clean and tidy and a place to sleep but 4 star is a bit of a stretch. Apart from the room, the pool area is also a bit average a bit of an afterthought tucked out the back of the building, and pretty small - perhaps 10m long maybe shorter and 3m wide. It also get direct sunlight in the afternoon with no real seating area or cover and as such the water is a sort of weird luke warm temperature. Not warm, not cold, not enjoyable. Noone seemed to last more than a couple of mins before leaving . The location itself is not bad, it is close to Luna Park and the train station is across the road which is handy. But it is the northshore so on foot there is nothing apart from Luna Park nearby and you find yourself traveling into the city often which makes you wonder why you didn't stay in there. The biggest complaint is the parking, I had confirmed and included on my booking I required a carpark which I was told I would pay for but would be no problem . Until I got there, yes they have parking - about 10 parks for the entire building of 100-200 rooms - so there was none, the entire time we were there. First in first served it appears even thou it was booked and noted on my confirmation. This wouldnt be the end of the world if ALL the surrounding streets were not pay parking - up to $3 AUD per 1/2 hour and you cant put more than 1 hour in and this runs until 12am every night - so effectively there is no parking - in the end we had to walk a good kilometer and find street parking which again was only good after 8pm without a permit . Average at best. Staff had a pretty much a tell someone who cares attitude and despite living and working there could not even explain what the parking signs on the road mean. So overall , average at best , its a room in a hotel nothing more.. its not particularly cheap so unless being very close to the also very average Luna Park is important would be worth considering other options, If your a tourist, pay a little more and stay in the CBD its worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Totally 'Vibeless'!!! very ordinary for a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elliotthoney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disappointment!! i'd research quite throughly before booking hotel as my husband & I were attending a friends wedding in Sydney and wanted to make the most of our time away. We paid $214 per night for our room, but to be honest, got the service and facilities in our room of a cheap motel!!! When we arrived, there was no warm greeting from the reception staff, and no one to take our bags to our room. Our's was on the 7th floor and we paid more to have views over darlington harbour. The view was great, but windows dirty! Very small standard box room with very little facilities. No bathrobes, the towels were small (and only one each!!). No proper hairdryer, only those ones that are attached to the wall which make the sound of a mosqito, when I asked reception if they had one, they seemed shocked that I'd even asked. When I wanted to speak to housekeeping, it rang and rang until the reception staff picked up. The bathroom was tiny, with a pathetic shower that went v hot or v cold in a v small bath. They market this hotel like it was a very funky, stylish, boutique hotel full of atmosphere! In actuality, it takes a lot more than a few brightly coloured cushions and some contemporary furniture to create anything like the atmosphere they say they have. There was only one reception staff, Andrea, on our three day stay there who was the standard I would expect -warm, helpful, polite and professional, and that was on checking out!! The only other redeeming things was the calamari salad we ordered from room service which was very good (but should be for $30), and the central location of the hotel .The reason they told me all was below par is they are in the middle of refurbishment, but that is absolutely no excuse for a very ordinary stay in very ordinary hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Miri27
Reviews.Content: This stylish hotel is close to all important sightseeing points. Our room was on the 7th floor and we didn't hear much noise of the city. The staff was friendly, however the bar didn't really convince. I would stay here again since it was good value for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: dakky68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone for two nights for a business trip in May 2008 and was very satisfied. I had a room on the sixth floor, right at the end of the building. As it was at the end and also on a corner, there were three windows which was great, and there was a bit of an extra hallway so it made the room seem larger. The views of Lavender Bay were great, and I could also see one end of the Harbour Bridge if I leant against the window, but could see a lot of the harbour past Lavender Bay. Had a view down onto the pool and also into a laneway between houses where I could see some school kids smoking in the morning, haha. Room service wasn't that cheap but I wasn't paying so didn't care! The meals were great, though. They had some special ones and also some simple ones for fussy people (or kids). Desserts and breakfasts were great, too. Had I not been in the end room it may have felt a bit small - I would definitely request a similar room if I returned there. On the website as at today's date, I would have been in an 'Aqua V Room', and it was furnished exactly the same way a year ago (same photo on website, in fact). Photo doesn't actually do the room justice.

Reviews.Title: “close to transport and luna park”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel on their website for a group of 8 , upon finding a deal on their site that suited us better we cancelled original booking and booked the package they had on offer which was exceptional value ( confirmation for cancelled booking recieved and new booking confirmation email recieved). Upon check in , we were told had no booking as it had been cancelled , WHAT!!!! problem quickly resolved and we were given last 2 rooms, we were very happy as we had been travelling for many hours, had a function to attend and had 7 other very worried women relying on me to get them their beds ! bar area nice although a little pricey for spirits, buffet brekky fabulous with a great selction..not 1 unhappy diner out of 8 women-that has to be saying something....pool area TERRIBLE, we were planning to have a leisurely swim and relax by the pool: 2 plastic chairs and an old table..if there are more than 5 people in the pool -forget it, no room...this floor was being renovated so hopefully the pool as well, very disappointing especially after showing the ladies in the group the pics of the "lovely pool area" where we were to have a bit of RnR.. housekeeping staff lovely and extremely helpful and prompt

Reviews.Title: “Don't get hooked by th trendy marketing”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_The_Gerbi1
Reviews.Content: Great, location, lovely foyer, but I'm fraid it stops there. The Reception area is decked out with modern funky decor, but its such a shame it doesn't leave that area. The rooms are in dire need for the same make over and the fittings and fixtures are well out dated. I'm also sour that they had the audacity to charge over 600 AU$ for a night during new years. Don't get sucked in by the trendy marketing and the selective photos on their website. It is the most expensive Travel Lodge you will ever stay at. And that is an insult to the Travel Lodge chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: glennharrold
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in great location in Sydney on North Side of Sydney literally 2 mins walk from the Harbour Bridge. We were there at New Year and the park adjacent to the hotel was one of the venues for the New Year celebrations. Ideally placed for getting the train into the Sydney CBD. Great room with nice views over a little marina - rear facing room - aqua - probably preferable. Good facilities in the room, clean, comfortable and very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: adl72
Reviews.Content: Good room, bigger than others (judging by the plan on the fire evacuation sign) overlooking Lavender Bay to rear of hotel. Good location - opposite the train station that has frequent trains to central Sydney. Great views to be had a short walk away of the Harbour bridge and the Opera House. Bed was a bit 'springy' and TV reception was not great. Restaurant was full at breakfast, so had to sit on the balcony - a bit chilly in August in Oz!!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: Schipem
Reviews.Content: We visited The Vibe in North Sydney from November 15th - 21st. This motel is nice and very centrally located - right across from the train station and also very close to the ferry at Luna Park. We got there at 10:00 a.m. The reception area seemed very nice. We told them we knew we were early, but wondered what time we could check in. The lady at the front desk told us about noon a room would be ready. So, after a 17 hour plane ride, we decided to go get something to eat just down the road. We walked back at noon and they told us that the housekeeping still didn't have it ready and it would be another hour. So, we walked to a friends place that was nearby. We waited to come back until 2:30 and still were told that the room wasn't ready! I got a little testy with them and they took us up to the bar to have drinks on them until it was ready. Well, needless to say I went back down at 3:00 and still not ready. They were then going to show us "upgrades" for the hotel - so we took their tour and wouldn't you know our initial room was ready! So, finally at 3:45 we were in our room! What service.... The room - Basic - we had a nice view of the Harbour. The bed was nice(r) than some hotels. The lighting wasn't the greatest by the bathroom/mirror. The shower door is only a half door, which I don't understand and so of course our floor was soaked each time we got out of the shower! We never ate at the restaurant there and so I can't really say much about that. Otherwise just an okay hotel. Nothing too great except for the location...would recommend it only for location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tfitzp
Reviews.Content: As we were planning to run in the Sydney Half Marathon last weekend, we booked a couple of rooms at the Vibe in June and glad that we did because they virtually doubled their prices shortly afterwards. In saying that we had a great stay - booked a Junior Suite for 2 adults/2 children and had a room on 11th floor overlooking Kirribilli area. Lots of lovely views/walks/eateries around the area, and only 4 mins by train from Milsons Point (opposite hotel) into CBD. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities but would probably stay there again because of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Let's go to Luna Park!!”
Reviews.Author: loulou1960
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about the property, I still decided to go ahead - we wanted to surprise our kids with a visit to Luna park, and you just couldn't beat the package they were offering. Besides, we thought, it's only for one night. Well, what a surprise. The booking went without a hitch, the check-in staff were professional and friendly, and the room was fantastic. We had a junior suite, which had plenty of room for two adults and two children. The main bedroom had a queen bed, and they provided a rollaway, and sofa lounge in the main room - great if your kids don't partucularly want to share a bed. And two TVs too - so the adults could watch the footy on Foxtel in one roon, and kids could watch TV in the other. The bathroom was modern and clean, and the view was great. We were exhausted after our day out, but didn't want room service so reception recommended a fantastic pizza place that delivered. Its such a shame that there have been bad reviews, I don't know, maybe they have cleaned up their act, or have new management - but I couldn't fault it. They have so many great packages too, Luna Park, the Zoo, the Aquarium etc - works out a really good deal with accom, breakfast, parking & tickets (and the good thing was that if it turned out to be a lousy day weather wise, you had three months to use the tickets). I'll definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but overpriced??”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night recently and the hotel was chosen to suit location and availability on the night. Other hotels in the area were booked out and this was the only place left in the area with rooms. So I paid what I consider to be a high price for what I got. the room was the usual - cheap built in furniture, queen bed, decent linen, postage stamp size towels, standard mass produced toiletries, standard TV with a couple of extra pay channels, mini bar, iron and board, small table etc. As per usual the pillows were flat and uncomfortable. so I had a room at the back of the hotel which overlooked lavendar bay - very lovely view, saw the sun set. The mini bar prices were the usual outrageous prices. the room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was all in good order - recently refurbished. I have stayed here once before and got a room at the front of the hotel. this was a bit of a disaster as the hotel overlooks milsons point rail station (FANTASTIC for city access) but trains start at 5am and toot their horns when they pull out. there are trains at every 10 mins whilst I was trying to sleep. I went down to the buffet breakfast which was OK - usual stuff - kelloggs cereals, toast, juices, danish, cheese, salami, tinned and fresh fruit. hot food included eggs, bacon, link sausages, beans. tea was really bad! also the carpark was full and I had to park out on the street average business hotel, reasonably comfortable but beware of paying too much

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CareerGirl
Reviews.Content: My room had a really nice view and was spacious, although the bathroom was small and cramped. The staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast in the restaurant was nice but a bit pricey to eat there daily. The hotel is within walking distance to restaurants and boutique-style shops and the train station is across the road. The park just down the road offers a great view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Viibes”
Reviews.Author: hazelha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my friend's wedding -she lives nearby, we were visiting from England. Brilliant location for seeing Sydney - right opposite Milsons Point railway station, only a few miinutes over the Harbour Bridge to the center of Sydney & all ferries, trains etc. Also close to the ferry stop which takes you to Darling Harbour (near the Olympic pool, not that well sign-posted) A very smart, modern hotel with great rooms. The higher up you are the better the views over the bays. Great rooftop pool too. Slightly worrying for older guests in our party - in their 70's they were told on check-in (as we were) that they needed to leave a credit card as deposit "in case they trashed the room!!" Also staff were not very accomodating of my friend who was leaving from there for her wedding & would not let her have her room one minute early! The suites on the top floors are much bigger, but the bathrooms are actually smaller than in the cheaper rooms. We didn't eat there although the restaurants looked fine - there are great breakfast places just along the road & around the corner, & if you go under the railway station some lovely Italian & Thai restaurants that are great value for the evening. I've been to Sydney many times & I would definitely stay here again - it's smart, modern & spotless, if a little impersonal. It's definitely a hotel for adults not kids.

Reviews.Title: “A 'hairy' experience...”
Reviews.Author: Otalie
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends in the area, I booked the nearby Vibe hotel for 1 night on [--]... Whilst comparatively cheap, I came away with the vibe that this property doesn't represent very good value for money. The (standard queen) room was clean and fairly comfortable, with pleasant views over the harbor/Kiribilli. The large amount of mold on bathroom tiles gave the bathroom a tired feel. A real let-down was the breakfast. My expectations weren't huge - this is a 4 star establishment which seems largely directed at the youth market... I found someone else's hair lodged in my mango which was very off-putting, then just a few minutes later, my dad who had joined me for breakfast found a different hair baked into his bread! Severely off-putting! Also disappointing was discovering that the mini marmalade on our table was not fresh and had already been opened and left there. Service-wise, the staff on check-in were great - very friendly. Unfortunately upon check-out I dealt with a young woman with a tongue piercing who was unsmiling and snappy.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired and in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: virtual_tourist_uk
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Vibe North Sydney. We had booked the hotel because it was close to were my wifeâ€™s sister lived whose wedding we were attending. After the 4 nights we stayed at their apartment whilst they were on honeymoon. The Vibe is about 20 â€“ 30 minutes from the airport. It is situated opposite the Railway Station and toll booths for the harbour bridge; however noise is not a problem due to the double glazing. The hotel lobby has a â€˜funkyâ€™ feel to it, bright colours and large fish bowls on the reception desk add to the atmosphere. As a family we had to book a suite, as the rooms only sleep 2. Our room was on the 11 floor. It was clean but did look a little tired and in need of some TLC. There was a microwave and coffee making facilities. The room had a great view of the Harbour and Harbour Bridge. The location of the hotel is very good, a 1 minute walk to the Railway Station or a 5 â€“ 7 minute walk to the pier to catch the ferry to Circular Quay. The hotel does have a swimming pool; however it is only big enough for maybe 2 â€“ 3 adults, as long as they stood still! There is an Olympic size swimming pool near to the pier, however it is salt water, but still refreshing nevertheless

Reviews.Title: “Vibe North Sydney great for "out of towners"”
Reviews.Author: hylands41
Reviews.Content: Vibe hotel North Sydney is great for those not familiar with Sydney. Well positioned across the road from the train station and only one stop into the city. Also handy to the ferry. After a slight hiccup at check in (they had my name correct but wrong address) our Aqua room was fine, with a great view of the harbour. Some reviewers have had problems with musty rooms but our was OK, also the furniture was not scratched or knocked about as some have reported. It is probably worth upgrading to the water view rooms as they seem better maintained. The aircon was efficient and very quiet (although it will not work until a room key is inserted into a slot - get two keys at check-in so you can leave one in the slot while you are out).The bathroom is small but nicely tiled. A potential problem for those travelling by car is that the car park (extra cost) is small and you are not guaranteed a spot. If the car park is full you have to park down the street at another parking station about 6-7 minutes walk, and back up a hill. We got the best deal by calling the hotel directly (better than their own website). This hotel is definately not five star, but at the price we paid it was fair value. It represents a good alternative to higher priced hotels right in the city yet is well served by public transport, even a taxi rank at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Healthy-Runner
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we stayed at the Vibe Hotel at North Sydney. The main purpose of the stay was to be close to the start of the Half Marathon event (Marathon and Fun Runs start from the same location). Last year we had a room with a view of the harbour. This year we had a room without the view, but the interior of the room was of similar quality. The room was a comfortable size with a queen bed, sofa, coffee table, desk and chair. The room and furnishings were very clean. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. Parking was available in the building for this year's visit. The location is excellent, even if you are not planning to participate in the events, as it is about 200 metres from the Milsons Point Railway Station, 400 metres from Sydney Harbour, 200 metres from the Harbour Bridge and relatively peaceful. We look forward to another visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy start to the wedding...”
Reviews.Author: teambloopy
Reviews.Content: My bridesmaid and I wanted to stay somewhere close by to where my wedding was and vibe was recommended by the venue. After leaving our bags there and checking in (but not into the room) earlier in the day, we arrived later that night to be told we did not have a room and that there was nothing resembling our name in the system. This misunderstanding was overcome by the duty manager (but with some unnecessary rudeness thrown in we thought) but then we ended up being given a key to a room with someone else in it. Not a nice thing to walk in on someone while they are sleeping - and not nice for the sleeping person either I imagine!! After another trip downstairs to reception we got another room key to the real room but this did not work. It took even more trips up and down the lift for this to be sorted out and by this stage we were both getting very annoyed at both the service we had been given and the general rudeness and bad attitudes that we were encountering. We realise that we were not acting the angels by this stage either but the way we were treated was totally uncalled for. Eventually, we had to call the groom to come to the hotel from the other side of the city and sort it out for us as we had both become quite upset after all these hassles. Finally we got into our room and it turned out to be quite nice (it was a suite) with a view over the harbour but unfortnately we were in no mood to enjoy the night lights. We were on the verge of just checking out the next day and being done with the place rather than staying the next 2 nights we had booked, however, the new duty manager the next morning was the ultimate professional and apologised for what had happened, asked us for our side of the story and treated us with the respect that had been missing from the night before. He compensated us for our inconvenience and made general amends for our bad experience. The rest of the stay was largely uneventful although the toilet was always running (which is annoying when trying to sleep) and the room was starting to show some signs of wear and tear. The wedding went ahead so that is the main thing I guess!!

Reviews.Title: “Gret little secret in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ric808
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in North Sydney, located next to the Harbour Bridge. The Milsons Point subway stop is right across the street. When we checked in, there had been a problem with our reservation and I was upgraded to a suite on the executive level. Wonderfully comfortable room, nice view of the Marina. The staff is helpful with giving directions and addressing guest needs. The hotel is rather hip; however, some of the furniture in the rooms looks a bit worn. Internet access is not free. Morning newspapers, which are promised at check-in, were never delivered. The underground parking is impossible to manuever. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back...”
Reviews.Author: ValerieBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I really was disappointed with the room. The second I walked in there was a gigantic roach in the room. The front desk said it was summer and switched my room, completely unconcerned with my complaint. They claimed it was an upgrade but the room looked exactly the same. Very disheartening. The room was a bit smelly and there was nothing impressive. I was grossed out and stayed only one night of the three I was supposed to stay. I'd rather spend the same amount of money and stay in downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: trisha1a
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for anyone who is not too familiar with Sydney as it was the perfect location. Loved walking around Lavendar and Kirribilli Bay. Staff were very helpful at reception. A bonus arriving in Sydney early morning (our original plan was to drop off the luggage) but the staff said that our room was ready and we could check in at 9.30am! Vibe's marketing material highlights a crisp and clean upmarket hotel. The upgrade is great but it shows a little wear and tear already. I was surprised that management did not notice this when they check rooms. It wasn't as fresh, new and sparkly as I had hoped for compared with the promtional material on the web and brochures. It's amazing what a professional photographer can do. Overall, after staying 2 nights in a Aqua View room I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs an excellent location and it is pretty good value. A bit of a difference compared to staying in a 5 star hotel. But you can save quite a bit of money when booking online or take up the specials. I would rather have the difference in money to spend in Sydney than pay an outrage price for a room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1105
Reviews.Content: The best position re ease of commuting - Milsons Point Station was opposite the hotel, the ferry to Circular Quay was an easy ten minute stroll. On the opposite side of the station there was a great street - Broughton Street, which was full of great restaurants. Nice safe area to be in. However, the room while comfortable was basic, lacking such essentials as a fan in the bathroom! Apparently none of the rooms have a fan in the bathroom - we asked! So bathroom was fogged up after someone had a shower/bath. The presence of a fan in the bathroom of any 4 star hotel should be a given. The room service menu is very basic. We wanted an Iced chocolate or Iced Coffee, which they told us they did not do! Having stayed there for 3 nights while attending a conference: a colleague stayed one further night paying for an upgrade to a better room: when she asked for a late check-out (one hour later than was the norm) , they would not extend her occupancy unless she paid for another night.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe Hotel was quite good”
Reviews.Author: djh1
Reviews.Content: Last week we spent a night at the Vibe Hotel in North Sydney. After reading some quite bad reports on various websites I thought I would mention that we found it a perfectly comfortable hotel in a good location for North Sydney. The room (a standard twin) was of an acceptable size and perfectly clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. My only complaint would be the quality of the buffet breakfast. It was quite expensive at $23.95 AUD and the quality of the food was only average. There was very little choice of cereals and the eggs had been sitting in the bain marie for a very long time! My recommendation is to stay in the hotel which has quite good rates, but go for breakfast elsewhere, there appeared to be little cafes within five minutes walk or a ferry across the harbour to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotttt
Reviews.Content: If you are after this particular location then the Vibe is adequate, but there is not much to recommend about the accomodation itself based on my room. Vibe Hotel is in a top location in Milson's Point. It is a short walk to the base of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and spectacular views across the water to the Opera House and city. This would be a good location if you need quick access to the city but want to stay somewhere more relaxing and quiet. It is a short drive to the city or you can catch the train across from the hotel and be in the city in a few minutes, and the trains seem quite good in Sydney. Also, make sure you take the short walk across to Kirribilli where you will find plenty of small shops and good eateries (although slightly pricey as you would expect just a few hundred metres from such great views). As for the Vibe hotel itself, I found it very average. The restaurant and bar are ok, my bed was comfortable enough, and the room was quiet. Some of the rooms would have good water views. However, my room looked old and worn, the TV was small and old, and the bathroom was cramped. The shower design and position meant that I had to kneel under the shower head and get blasted with cold water to turn the shower on. The worst part was the musty smell of my floor and room - although I realised later that I was in a smoking room, but surely it still shouldn't smell that bad. The swimming pool is tiny. Good location, average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels but for the price ($A150) it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Becandjamie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night with many other family members all in separate rooms. Although we all booked together, we were not all on the same floor as requested. But that was not the end of the world, it was a large group and that is understandable. Views are great, location is excellent, opposite Milson's Point train station and 5 minutes to the city on the train. I also stayed at the hotel when it was "The Duxton" and I think the decor and service were better then. We had a problem with parking, but fluked the last park quite luckily, it was a Saturday night. Breakfast was ok, service was ok. The staff were nothing to rave about as far as service goes - the staff were quiet rude to me and some of the rest of our family - and did not go out of their own way to assist either at reception or at breakfast. The decor is quite tired although the website says it was renovated in 2004. Reception and restaurant are funky but rooms are a bit dated. But the views make up for it. Average sized rooms, average sized bathrooms. I found it cheaper on the Vibe Hotel website than thru any other hotel booking website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dashia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Vibe hotel several times. I must admit when it was a Duxton it was slightly better in most ways. However we got a room right up the top with an awesome view that really made up for any lackings! My advise is to book on their website or on a similiar site with good deals that way you'll be much happier with the prices. We've had room service and the food was fine however there are some great restaurants near by. I do hope that they invest into their hotel as with the views it truly is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Vibe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dated. The decor was nasty. The TV was old and small. The bed was uncomfortable. The pool was tiny. There are many better hotels in Sydney for the same price. The owners are looking to turn the hotel in to an apartment block as soon as they can get approval so I guess are not wanting to waste any money on renovations.

HotelInfo.Name: Vibe Hotel North Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 88 Alfred Street, Milsons Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2061, Australia
